member.summary: The entry point for standalone silo processes. See .

member.name: T:Orleans.TestingHost.TestCluster
member.summary: A host class for local testing with Orleans using in-process silos. Runs a Primary and optionally secondary silos in separate app domains, and client in the main app domain. Additional silos can also be started in-process on demand if required for particular test cases.
member.remarks: Make sure that your test project references your test grains and test grain interfaces projects, and has CopyLocal=True set on those references [which should be the default].

member.name: P:Orleans.TestingHost.TestCluster.Primary
member.summary: Primary silo handle, if applicable.
member.remarks: This handle is valid only when using Grain-based membership.

member.name: P:Orleans.TestingHost.TestCluster.SecondarySilos
member.summary: List of handles to the secondary silos.

member.name: P:Orleans.TestingHost.TestCluster.Silos
member.summary: Collection of all known silos.

member.name: P:Orleans.TestingHost.TestCluster.Options
member.summary: Options used to configure the test cluster.
member.remarks: This is the options you configured your test cluster with, or the default one. If the cluster is being configured via ClusterConfiguration, then this object may not reflect the true settings.

member.name: T:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator
member.summary: A wrapper on Azure Storage Emulator.
member.remarks: It might be tricky to implement this as a IDisposable, isolated, autonomous instance, see at Use the Azure Storage Emulator for Development and Testing for pointers.

member.name: F:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator.storageEmulatorProcessNames
member.summary: The storage emulator process name. One way to enumerate running process names is Get-Process | Format-Table Id, ProcessName -autosize. If there were multiple storage emulator processes running, they would named WASTOR~1, WASTOR~2, ... WASTOR~n.

member.name: M:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator.IsStarted
member.summary: Is the storage emulator already started.
member.returns: if this instance is started; otherwise, .

member.name: P:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator.Exists
member.summary: Checks if the storage emulator exists, i.e. is installed.
member.value: if the storage emulator exists; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator.Help
member.summary: Storage Emulator help.

member.name: M:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator.TryStart
member.summary: Tries to start the storage emulator.
member.returns: if the process was started successfully; otherwise.

member.name: M:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator.Start
member.summary: Starts the storage emulator if not already started.
member.returns: if the process was started successfully; otherwise.

member.name: M:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator.Stop
member.summary: Stops the storage emulator if started.
member.returns: if the process was stopped successfully or was already stopped; otherwise.

member.name: M:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator.CreateProcessArguments(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new ProcessStartInfo to be used as an argument to other operations in this class.
member.returns: A new that has the given arguments.

member.name: M:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator.GetStorageEmulatorProcess
member.summary: Queries the storage emulator process from the system.
member.returns: if the storage emulator process was found, otherwise.

member.name: M:Orleans.TestingHost.Utils.StorageEmulator.GetStorageEmulatorPath
member.summary: Returns a full path to the storage emulator executable, including the executable name and file extension.
member.returns: A full path to the storage emulator executable, or null if not found.
